content.question: What happened to the old Spitball and where did all my documents go?
content.answer: We here at Spitball like to make you guys happy, and we recognized that our last website was just not cutting it! Using feedback from our dedicated users, we revamped and re-designed Spitball from the ground up. Don't worry though - all the documents from the old Spitball are still available! Just search for your class under "Study Documents" Then click on "Source" and "Spitball.co" to filter only Spitball results.

content.question: Is there a Spitball app?
content.answer: Indeed! We have an IOS app, and we’re working as fast as we can to bring our new app to Google Play.

content.question: Is Spitball free?
content.answer: Spitball is a free service. Some of our partner sites, however, may require you to pay to unlock certain content, meet with a tutor, or buy a textbook.

content.question: Why isn't my school on Spitball?
content.answer: If you don’t see your school on Spitball and think we should add it, email us at support@spitball.co

content.question: Why doesn't my class have files?
content.answer: Your class could be new, or none of your classmates have posted documents online. Don’t fret - we have flashcards, tutors and textbooks to help you ace your exams. If you still can’t find what you need, shoot us an email at support@spitball.co or contact us on social media and we’ll try to help you out!

content.question: I’m finding content that isn’t relevant. Help!
content.answer: Don’t forget to personalize your results to your university and specific courses. You can do this on the search results page by clicking “Personalize” on the left hand side

content.question: How do I edit my profile?
content.answer: From the search results page, click “Personalize” on the left hand side to update your university and courses. You can also click the three dots in the top right corner of your screen.

content.question: How do I contact Spitball?
content.answer: You can contact us on our homepage, or email us at support@spitball.co

content.question: What is Spitball's policy regarding academic integrity?
content.answer: Spitball was created as a community for collaborative learning. Students benefit from sharing knowledge, and our objective is to make students' lives easier by creating one unified platform to meet all of their academic needs. We are founded on the principles of transparency and collaboration and are firmly opposed to plagiarism, cheating, and any form of academic misconduct.
